title: IT Intern - USA-MA-Boston
text: Profile The IT Internconfigures and supports the company’s desktops, laptops, printers, and phone systems at Accruent. The candidate will be responsible for providing technical support to the end users, setting up equipment for users, and user account maintenance.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESProvide quality workstation and phone support to end users in a timely manner.Manage Helpdesk requests from internal users which include troubleshooting hardware, software, operating systems, and network connectivity issues.Install, configure and troubleshoot workstation and laptop hardware, peripherals, operating systems, business software, and third-party applications.Configure and troubleshoot of network printers, network scanners, and local printers.Perform interoffice computer equipment moves.Troubleshoot remote access issues both software and hardware.Provide support of VMware virtualization, Windows server, and server applications such as Exchange, SQL, and SharePoint.Test and deploy new client/server applications and hardware in an enterprise environmentAssist in the maintenance and development of support practices and IT documentation as needed.Image and deploy workstations for new hires and system upgrades.Participate in projects and initiatives as they relate to the end-user support functionMaintains inventory of equipment, related software and manuals.Administers user additions, deletions and changes.Performs day-to-day network maintenance such as ensuring adequate file server space, and virus detectionRecommends upgrades, patches, and new applications and equipment.Ability to carry out all policies and procedures as established by the team, department or company at largeConsistently demonstrate Accruent’s values: respect, integrity, drive to excellence, results orientation, winning attitude, AND hard workKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES1-2 years hands on experience supporting and maintaining a corporate IT environment.Great communication and interpersonal skillsSelf-reliant and motivated self-starterProject and task oriented with a focus on detailsAbility to work well within group or individually on projectsMCP, A , or Network Certification desiredABOUT ACCRUENTAccruent helps real estate and facilities leaders deliver long-term, world-class operational and financial performance through industry-specific suites that deliver greater customer value. Accruent’s solutions are at work in more than 4,000 leading organizations worldwide, including 40 percent of the top 100 retailers, 20 percent of the Fortune 500, 45 percent of the leading universities, all of the top 4 U.S. wireless carriers, 40 percent of U.S. hospitals, and leading service providers managing more than 4 billion square feet of property. Founded in 1995, Accruent is headquartered in Austin with offices in Santa Monica, Evanston, Columbus, Pittsburgh, Boston, Vancouver and Hong Kong. For more information, visitwww.accruent.com
